clinical_study.brief_title: The Added Value of Contrast Enhancement for Guiding EUS-FNA in Solid Pancreatic Masses
clinical_study.official_title: The Added Value of Contrast Enhancement for Guiding EUS-FNA in Solid Pancreatic Masses
clinical_study.source: Iuliu Hatieganu University of Medicine and Pharmacy

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective study designed to show the superiority of contrast guided echoendoscopy versus conventional echoendoscopy

detailed_description.textblock: A prospective study that compares the results using FNA contrast echoendoscopy versus standard FNA echoendoscopy in the diagnosis of solid pancreatic tumors

primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic accuracy of CEUS FNA endosonography versus standard FNA endosonography in the etiological cyto histological of pancreatic solid tumors using histology core as comparison between the two methods
primary_outcome.description: Diagnostic accuracy of CEUS FNA endosonography versus standard FNA endosonography in the etiological cyto histological of pancreatic solid tumors using histology core as comparison between the two methods

secondary_outcome.measure: Quality of histological specimen(histology core) obtained with the two types of FNA biopsies (contrast enhanced and standard)
Dysfunction in the two types of biopsies
secondary_outcome.description: failure or difficulty reports with each procedure (%)

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison between standand endosonography and contrast enhanced endosonography in obtaining a superior quality in obtaining histology core

arm_group.description: First passage in the solid pancreatic tumor using FNA endosonography then with the contrast enhanced FNA endosonography
First passage in the solid pancreatic tumor using contrast enhanced FNA endosonography then with the FNA endosonography

intervention.description: Puncture of the pancreatic solid mass with fine needle aspiration under endoscopic ultrasonographic control. Passage in the same pancreatic mass of first using standard FNA method then contrast enhanced FNA method or vice versa according to the randomization

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- solid pancreatic tumor lesions
Exclusion Criteria:
- severe coagulopathy of trombocytopenia <50.000
- patients refuse for biopsy prelevation or pacient's refuse to participate in the study
